artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Minatoya Kohei; Carver: Ōtaya Takichi
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: portrait of man wearing bright red wig or headdress, tied with red cord under his chin; man wears garments with various patterns including white, blue and brown plaid, red, pink, blue and yellow squares, and fabric with gold dragons on black ground; landscape in background with trees and building at left; red cartouche with text, yellow flower and black lantern with yellow circles in URC
markings: date seal: 子十 {ne jū} (Rat 10) | censor seals: 福 {Fuku} | 村松 {Muramatsu} | publisher\'s seal: {Minatoko ban} | carver: 彫多吉 {Hori Takichi}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Sixty-Nine Stations along the Kiso Highway (Kiso rokujūkyū tsugi 木曽六十九驛)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: Makinohara at Mochizuki Station: (Actor Nakamura Utaemon IV as) Ōtaka Tonomo
